events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection, resulting in moderate damage to the front bumper and hood.
Claim has been categorised under Auto Accident based on keywords from the initial report mentioning the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the claim and communicate with the claimant regarding the required next steps.
A notification was sent to the claimant acknowledging receipt of the accident claim and providing contact details for further information.
The claimant was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and proof of insurance to proceed with the claim processing.
The claimant provided all requested documents including detailed pictures of the damage and the official police accident report.
The investigation team began assessing the claim details and verifying the circumstances of the car accident with all submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant’s responsibility was minimal and damage was consistent with reported accident circumstances.
A settlement offer was prepared and communicated to the claimant reflecting the estimated repair costs and coverage limits.
The claimant responded with appreciation for the timely handling of the claim and agreed to the terms of the proposed settlement.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance provider, allowing for the repair payments to be processed immediately.
The insurance company issued the payment for the approved claim amount to the claimant’s designated bank account.
The claim was officially closed following the successful completion of vehicle repairs and receipt of all necessary confirmations.
All documents and records related to the auto accident claim have been archived in the system for future reference and compliance.
